<<<api>>>: Vector
<<<code>>>: String stringWithoutArraySymbols = newfollowerlist.toString().replaceAll("[\\[\\]]", "");
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the toString() method of the Vector class to convert the vector into a string representation. Then, you can use the replaceAll() method with a regular expression to remove the square brackets from the string. The regular expression "[\\[\\]]" matches both "[" and "]".

<<<api>>>: Vector
<<<code>>>: Vector<String> newfollowerlist = new Vector<String>();
newfollowerlist.add("name1");
newfollowerlist.add("name2");
newfollowerlist.add("name3");
newfollowerlist.add("name4");

String stringWithoutArraySymbols = newfollowerlist.toString().replaceAll("\\[|\\]", "");
<<<explanation>>>: To parse a Vector to a normal String, you can use the toString() method of the Vector class, which will return a string representation of the Vector. Then, you can use the replaceAll() method with regular expressions to remove the square brackets. In the provided code, we create a new Vector, add the names to it, and then convert it to a string. Finally, we use the replaceAll() method to remove the square brackets.
